Justification: MSNBC has a strong liberal editorial stance with significant opinion-driven content, especially in its primetime programming.
Vox leans left, known for explanatory journalism often with progressive framing and a mix of news and opinion.
The Guardian leans left with high factual reporting, blending investigative journalism and left-leaning commentary.
Politico is mostly centrist with some left-of-center lean, focused on political reporting and analysis.
Reuters is considered one of the most neutral and reliable sources, focused on factual, international news reporting.
HuffPost has a progressive bias with a strong emphasis on opinion, commentary, and advocacy journalism.
AP is highly factual and neutral, specializing in wire-style hard news reporting.
BBC is slightly left-leaning in cultural framing but widely recognized for its factual reporting and global coverage.
The Dispatch leans center-right with a focus on conservative intellectual commentary and original reporting.
Fox News exhibits a strong conservative bias, with much of its primetime content rooted in opinion and commentary.
Breitbart is far-right, heavily ideological, and primarily publishes opinionated and provocative commentary.
Fox Business leans conservative with a mix of business reporting and opinion-driven political coverage.
NYT leans left editorially but maintains a strong reputation for investigative reporting and journalistic rigor.
The Atlantic leans liberal and features a high volume of commentary and longform journalism.
The Economist leans center-right on economics and centrist socially, with mostly analytical, high-quality content.
The New Yorker leans liberal, with emphasis on essays, longform journalism, and opinion.
WSJ leans right in editorial pages but is praised for strong, factual business and economic reporting.
A conservative outlet with strong ideological lean and a mix of reporting and opinion.
National Review is a longstanding conservative magazine with ideological commentary and some factual reporting.
ABC News is broadly centrist with slight left-leaning framing and a focus on mainstream broadcast journalism.
Al Jazeera leans slightly left, with strong international reporting and some ideological framing.
Similar to BBC, this is their global-facing hard news service with strong neutrality and factual accuracy.
Leans slightly left, with a blend of business reporting, tech coverage, and opinion.
Canadian-based with a center-right economic bias, and mostly original reporting.
Neutral, science-based source focused on factual, evidence-based health reporting.
Generally neutral, with strong scientific and environmental reporting.
Leans progressive in tech and culture framing, with mixed reporting and opinion.
Time leans slightly left and mixes factual reporting with commentary and features.
Wired leans liberal in tech and cultural topics, balancing news with interpretive features.
Axios is mostly centrist with a modern, fact-driven style and a focus on brevity and original reporting.
Vice leans progressive and youth-oriented, with a blend of edgy reporting and left-leaning opinion.
WaPo leans left editorially, but maintains strong investigative and factual reporting standards.
Conservative-leaning aggregation site with original polling analysis and issue-focused commentary.
Investigative-style conservative site with a focus on government and political issues.
Fiscally conservative newswire focusing on public policy and state-level reporting.
Populist tabloid with a mix of real political reporting and sensational commentary.
Centrist/liberal news site with a focus on politics and policy.
Centrist news site with a focus on politics and policy.
